entities.description: The respondent's history of substance use over their lifetime.
A special code indicating inferred responses for substance use.
Specifies the time frame of the respondent's last use of a substance.
Follow-up questions asked to respondents for clarifying answers.
Category of substances that are prescribed medications.
Procedures used to standardize and infer responses on substance use.
The age at which the respondent first used a substance.
The corrected value indicating the last use of a substance as determined by editing procedures.

relationships.description: Indicates the respondent's history of substance use over their lifetime.
Defines that the response was inferred through logical assignment.
Specifies the most recent time period the respondent used a substance.
Relates the survey to the follow-up questions asked for further clarification.
Indicates that prescription drugs are a type of substance.
Identifies the person who is responding to the survey.
Indicates the use of standard editing procedures for substance use responses.
Defines the age at which the respondent first used a substance.
Relates the time frame of last substance use to the edited value determined by procedures.
